00012 //: Searches over a grid using normalised correlation.
00013 class mfpf_norm_corr2d : public mfpf_point_finder
00014 {
00015  private:
00016   //: Kernel reference point (in kni_ x knj_ grid)
00017   double ref_x_;
00018   //: Kernel reference point (in kni_ x knj_ grid)
00019   double ref_y_;
00020 
00021   //: Relative size of region used for estimating overlap
00022   //  If 0.5, then overlap requires pt inside central 50% of region.
00023   double overlap_f_;
00024 
00025   //: Filter kernel to search with
00026   vil_image_view<double> kernel_;
00027 
00028   //: Define default values
00029   void set_defaults();
00030 
00031  public:
00032 
00033   // Dflt ctor
00034   mfpf_norm_corr2d();
00035 
00036   // Destructor
00037   virtual ~mfpf_norm_corr2d();
00038 
00039   //: Define filter kernel to search with.
00040   //  Reference point set to the centre
00041   void set(const vil_image_view<double>& k);
00042 
00043   //: Define filter kernel to search with
00044   void set(const vil_image_view<double>& k,
00045            double ref_x, double ref_y);
00046 
00047   //: Define filter kernel to search with, expressed as a vector
00048   virtual bool set_model(const vcl_vector<double>& v);
00049 
00050   //: Number of dimensions in the model
00051   virtual unsigned model_dim();
00052 
00053   //: Relative size of region used for estimating overlap
00054   //  If 0.5, then overlap requires pt inside central 50% of region.
00055   void set_overlap_f(double);
00056 
00057   //: Filter kernel to search with
00058   const vil_image_view<double>& kernel() const { return kernel_; }
00059 
00060   //: Filter kernel to search with, expressed as a vector
00061   void get_kernel_vector(vcl_vector<double>& v) const;
00062 
00063   //: Get sample of region around specified point in image
00064   virtual void get_sample_vector(const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00065                                  const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00066                                  const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u,
00067                                  vcl_vector<double>& v);
00068 
00069   //: Radius of circle containing modelled region
00070   virtual double radius() const;
00071 
00072   //: Evaluate match at p, using u to define scale and orientation
00073   // Returns -1*edge strength at p along direction u
00074   virtual double evaluate(const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00075                           const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00076                           const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u);
00077 
00078   //: Evaluate match at in a region around p
00079   // Returns a quality of fit at a set of positions.
00080   // response image (whose size and transform is set inside the
00081   // function), indicates the points at which the function was
00082   // evaluated.  response(i,j) is the fit at the point
00083   // response.world2im().inverse()(i,j).  The world2im() transformation
00084   // may be affine.
00085   virtual void evaluate_region(const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00086                                const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00087                                const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u,
00088                                vimt_image_2d_of<double>& response);
00089 
00090   //: Search given image around p, using u to define scale and angle
00091   //  On exit, new_p defines position of the best nearby match.
00092   //  Returns a quality of fit measure at that
00093   //  point (the smaller the better).
00094   virtual double search_one_pose(const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00095                                  const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00096                                  const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u,
00097                                  vgl_point_2d<double>& new_p);
00098 
00099   // Returns true if p is inside region at given pose
00100   // Actually only checks if p is inside bounding box,
00101   // scaled by a factor f about the reference point.
00102   bool is_inside(const mfpf_pose& pose,
00103                  const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00104                  double f=1.0) const;
00105 
00106   //: Return true if modelled regions at pose1 and pose2 overlap
00107   //  Checks if reference point of one is inside region of other
00108   virtual bool overlap(const mfpf_pose& pose1,
00109                        const mfpf_pose& pose2) const;
00110 
00111   //: Generate points in ref frame that represent boundary
00112   //  Points of a contour around the shape.
00113   //  Used for display purposes.
00114   virtual void get_outline(vcl_vector<vgl_point_2d<double> >& pts) const;
00115 
00116   //: Return an image of the kernel
00117   virtual void get_image_of_model(vimt_image_2d_of<vxl_byte>& image) const;
00118 
00119   //: Version number for I/O
00120   short version_no() const;
00121

00123   virtual vcl_string is_a() const;
